answerText: Robertson Davies[10] This author's Coming Through Slaughter fictionalizes the life of ragtime trumpeter Buddy Bolden. The author goes back to Sri Lanka and attempts to learn more about his father in his memoir Running in the Family, but he is most famous for writing The English Patient.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | University of North Carolina, Truman State A, and University of Toronto | 13 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: name these Canadian authors who aren't Margaret Atwood:  [10] This author wrote about the return of Parlabane in his novel The Rebel Angels. The autobiography of Dustable Ramsay is the basis for this man's Fifth Business, the first book of his Deptford Trilogy.
